title.narrative: Mainstreaming Climate Resilience Into Development Planning ; Gender, M&E And Mainstreaming At Sub-National Levels- Cambodia

description.narrative: The primary purpose of the project is the enhance to capacity of national and sub-national agencies to respond to the climate change impacts through building climate proof infrastructure at city level. Project is framed as part of the larger technical assistance programme to enhance the capacity of the key government institutions mandated to deal with climate change related work in the country. Main area of interventions are 1. Institutional and technical Capacity building among the national and sub-national level government institutions on Climate change 2. 2.Developingand establishingMonitoring and Evaluation framework for Climate change actions3.3.MainstreamedClimate resilienceinto Sub National Level development plans and investment programmes ( provincial, city and commune level )4.4. facilitatingSub-national level climate financing 5. 5.Integrating Gender consideration in CC adaptation UN Habitat is partnering withSave the Earth Cambodia and Forum Syd Sweden in implementing the project to meet the national requirements of capacity building on Climate Change. UN Habitat with other partners will contribute to enhance the knowledge and will be able to produce set of knowledge products as advocacy tools.

department.narrative: Regional Office for Asia and the Pacific

mailing-address.narrative: UN-HABITAT P.O. Box 30030 GPO Nairobi 00100 Kenya
